abstract: Guggenheim Partners agrees to pay $20 million to settle charges by Securities and Exchange Commission that it failed to disclose $50 million personal loan to one of its senior executives from client; names of both parties are withheld.
lead_paragraph: The settlement covers a charge brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission that the firm failed to disclose a $50 million loan from a client to an executive.

headline.main: Guggenheim Partners Pays $20 Million to Settle S.E.C. Charges
headline.print_headline: Guggenheim Partners Pays $20 Million to Settle With S.E.C.

snippet: The settlement covers a charge brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission that the firm failed to disclose a $50 million loan from a client to an executive.
